text: Hi all. Does anybody know if a “loading” route can have a state? My use case is showing some kind of progress on the loading process
Also in the form of a Stack Overflow question, if anyone wants the karma: <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30550380/extra-information-in-loading-substate>

attachments.title: Extra information in `loading` substate
attachments.text: I have an Ember app. In a given route, I have a handcrafted model that is not loaded immediately. Thus, I hand it over as a promise: export default Ember.Route.extend({ model() { return
